## Trend Analysis

First, we explore the relationships among variables of sleep debt, screen time (\>15 min) and message with measurement window of three hours:

```{python}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| output: true

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from matplotlib.lines import Line2D

# Assuming df1 is already defined as df
df1 = df

# Data preparation steps (as per your instructions)
df1['screen_time_bin'] = None

# Creating bins as [0, 10), [10, 20), ...
bins = list(range(0, 190, 10))  # Define bins from 0 to 180 in steps of 10
labels = [f"[{bins[i]},{bins[i+1]})" for i in range(len(bins)-1)]  # Create labels like '[0,10)', '[10,20)', etc.

# Creating screen_time_bin column using pd.cut
df1['screen_time_bin'] = pd.cut(df1['screen_time'], bins=bins, labels=labels, right=False, include_lowest=True)

# Aggregating data for each bin
grouped = df1.groupby('screen_time_bin').agg({
    'sleep_debt': 'mean',
    'message': 'mean',
    'screen_time': 'count'
}).reset_index()

# Plotting
plt.rcParams['font.family'] = 'Times New Roman'
fig, ax1 = plt.subplots(figsize=(14, 8))

# Line plot for sleep debt trend
line1, = ax1.plot(grouped['screen_time_bin'], grouped['sleep_debt'], color='purple',
                  linestyle='-', marker='o', label='Sleep Debt')
for x, y in zip(grouped['screen_time_bin'], grouped['sleep_debt']):
    ax1.annotate(f'{y:.2f}', (x, y), textcoords="offset points", xytext=(0, 10), ha='center', color='purple')

# X and Y labels
ax1.set_xlabel('Screen Time (minutes)', fontsize=14, color='black')
ax1.set_ylabel('Sleep Debt (minutes)', fontsize=14, color='black')
ax1.tick_params(axis='x', rotation=30, labelcolor='black', labelsize=10)
ax1.tick_params(axis='y', labelcolor='black', labelsize=12)
# ax1.set_title('Sleep Debt, Screen Time and Message')

# Secondary axis for message count
ax2 = ax1.twinx()
line2, = ax2.plot(grouped['screen_time_bin'], grouped['message'], color='darkorange',
                  linestyle='-', marker='o', label='Message')
for i, txt in enumerate(grouped['message']):
    ax2.annotate(f'{txt:.2f}', (grouped['screen_time_bin'][i], grouped['message'][i]),
                 textcoords="offset points", xytext=(0, 10), ha='center', color='darkorange')
ax2.set_ylabel('Message', fontsize=14, color='black')
ax2.tick_params(axis='y', labelcolor='black', labelsize=12)

# Tertiary axis for bar plot of observations
ax3 = ax1.twinx()
bars = ax3.bar(grouped['screen_time_bin'], grouped['screen_time'], width=0.4, color='lightblue',
               alpha=0.3, label='Number of Observations')
ax3.spines['right'].set_position(('outward', 60))

# Hide the axis for Number of Observations
ax3.get_yaxis().set_visible(False)
ax3.spines['right'].set_visible(False)

# Draw connection lines from bar bottoms to the x-axis range
for bar, bin_label in zip(bars, grouped['screen_time_bin']):
    bar_x = bar.get_x() + bar.get_width() / 2
    bar_bottom = bar.get_y()
    ax1.add_line(Line2D([bar_x, bar_x], [bar_bottom, -10], color='gray', linestyle='-'))

for bar in bars:
    yval = bar.get_height()
    ax3.text(bar.get_x() + bar.get_width() / 2, yval, f'{int(yval)}', va='bottom', ha='center', color='black')

# Legend
lines = [line1, line2]
bars_proxy = plt.Line2D([0], [0], color='lightblue', alpha=0.3, lw=8)
labels = ['Sleep Debt', 'Message', 'Number of Observations']
fig.legend(lines + [bars_proxy], labels, loc='upper right', bbox_to_anchor=(0.96, 0.99), fontsize=12)

# Tight layout and save
fig.tight_layout()
plt.savefig('/Users/shaokangyang/Downloads/model-free.svg', format='svg', dpi=300)
plt.show()
```

## Clustering Analysis

### Cluster=11

#### Front view

```{python}
#| echo: false
#| warning: false
#| output: true

from sklearn.cluster import KMeans
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
from mpl_toolkits.mplot3d import Axes3D
random_seed = 1
#df1 = df[df['message'] < 240]
df1=df
df1.loc[df1['unlock'] > 41, 'unlock'] = 41;df1.loc[df1['message'] > 96, 'message'] = 96
# Normalizing the data
scaler = StandardScaler()
df_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(df1[['screen_time', 'unlock', 'message']])
# KMeans clustering on normalized data
kmeans = KMeans(n_clusters=11,random_state=random_seed)
clusters = kmeans.fit_predict(df_scaled)
# Adding the cluster data to the original dataframe
df1['cluster'] = clusters+1
# Visualizing the clusters in 3D with normalized data
# Custom colors for each cluster (12 in total)
nature_colors = [
    '#1f77b4',  # Blue
    '#ff7f0e',  # Orange
    '#2ca02c',  # Green
    '#d62728',  # Red
    '#9467bd',  # Purple
    '#ffbb78',  # Light Orange
    '#7a876f',  # Pink
    '#17becf',  # Gray
    '#bcbd22',  # Olive
    '#c27ba0',  # Yellow
    '#aec7e8',  # Light Blue
    '#8c564b',   # Brown
    '#c27ba0'
]
fig = plt.figure(figsize=(16, 9.6))
ax = fig.add_subplot(111, projection='3d')
# Plotting each cluster with a custom color
for i in range(1, 12):  # Cluster numbers now range from 1 to 12
    cluster_data = df1[df1['cluster'] == i]
    ax.scatter(cluster_data['screen_time'], cluster_data['unlock'], cluster_data['message'], 
               color=nature_colors[i - 1], label=f'Cluster {i}', marker='o')
ax.set_title('Behavior Segmentation for Smartphone Use (Cluster=11)')
ax.set_xlabel('Screen Time (minutes)')
ax.set_ylabel('Unlock Frequency')
ax.set_zlabel('Number of Messages')
# Legend
ax.legend(title="Clusters")
plt.show()
```
